description:
A lovely, affordable cup of coffee that strips itself down to the basics while still having a bunch of character. I ordered an iced coffee and it was well brewed with a slight tinge of sourness balanced with a good, earthy flavor.

If you're looking to check out a place that has a more homey feel compared to some of the SF coffee titans, I'd highly recommend this place.
author: Akhil N.

description: Solid coffee and good service! I would definitely recco the iced coffee. I also really like their decor and vibe.
author: Ani J.

description:
Food is good, fast service on the chai. However, the lady who was making the sandwiches was spaced out! She asked me three times if it was to go. Asked me if I wanted pesto in my sandwich, to which I replied NO. However, she had put pesto in the sandwich! She had long hair, was getting into the space she was making sandwiches, hello health hazards! She was wearing rubber gloves, touching all the ingredients, then also opening the microwave with those same gloves!! 

Not impressed how they touched the food and appliances! I suggest you guys put forks or spoons on all of your ingredients so your employees don't touch food and everything else at the same time. Please inform your employees to take care of their hair while making sandwiches! 

First time here, not going again that's for sure!
author: Ruthie M.

description: This is such a cute little coffee shop! I love the casual atmosphere and small mom-and-pop shop feel. The quality of their coffee and teas is great. And there's also a bookshelf with classics and travel books. I highly recommend that you check out this place! Will definitely go again!
author: Jessica Y.

description: I'm born and raised in SF, and I have lived off Polk St. for close to 22 years, with that being said, I do miss the old Royal Grounds, but this is a charming neighborhood spot with an awesome owner that can be seen here and there interacting with customers and community alike. Great coffee, cool vibe, good people watching. LEGIT.
author: John A.

description: One of my favorite places in SF! Very smooth cold brew and the 16oz only costs $2.50, whereas most coffee places sell for $5! Great value, great coffee, and the sweetest people.
author: Ashley O.

description: Seems there are many regulars that make a quick stop for their sandwiches or bagels. Their pesto bagel was absolutely delicious. The ambiance is cute with some seating outside as well. The music is more jazz than pop. The only downside was the reluctance of the server when I asked for an extra sleeve for my bagel as the pesto leaked through.
author: Kimberly H.

description:
Drink food 
Coffee 


Service 
Sweet, strong and free wifi 
Nice workers 

Atmosphere 
Super cute cafe, ample outlets, high top bar seating facing out to people watch, some small cute outdoor cafe tables, as well as some booths inside, and high tables. Along Polk street so super convenient to walk to any other restaurants or shops/bars before or after.
author: Angela L.

description: Moka is fabulous! It was my first time here today & on the next day after Thanksgiving you guys are open early in AM with fresh brewed amazing coffee! What a great job! Chicken pesto panini was great! Omg! See the pic attached;-) Both Vadim and Merve were super nice and friendly. I'm absolutely coming back!
author: Kat Z.

description: This place was straight up not good. Stopped by after getting donuts at Bob's (go there), bitter espresso and their Moka had a horrible aftertaste. Should've just gone to Starbucks.
author: Shiva A.

description: So it's a Monday and brain is revving up but body is sore. What do bean hunters do? Waltz into Moka, of course. They tango with good vibes, samba with well made coffee, bossanova with passionate execution, serve and vibe with rock style vibing, and jazz with spirit. Observing them while slowly sipping my coffee leads me to believe by instinct they have it going. A vibrant and stylish joint, fun people, like the environment, say hi Merve and Vadim, love y'alls.
author: Juls C.

description: Just passing by and discovered this little coffee and tea cafe. Really good coffee. Love the way the windows open to bring outdoors in. Nice place to relax and enjoy SF.
author: Maureen K.

description: The coffee here is not great. The location is awesome and central but don't expect to fall in love with this place. Better bets are to walk up Polk to St Franks, or up Sacramento to Another Cafe. Contraband is also around the corner, but it's 3rd on my personal preferences.
author: Nic F.

description:
If I could give zero stars I would. Came in for an iced latte this afternoon and the barista (blonde with heavy European accent) was very rude and snappy. I will not be returning as this lady seems to Have a real problem with customers. After reading some other reviews on here from today I don't think I was the only person to have an issue. 

Hope the owners are able to do something about this employee.

If she is the owner I hope she is able to safely remove the stick from her ass.
author: Mike M.

description: My espresso was great. During the time I was here, service was prompt and friendly for all customers. Nice neighborhood coffeeshop. I will come back if I'm in the area again.
author: Andrew H.

description: In this instance, I actually wish I could give 0 stars for the abhorrent service my friends and I received this Sunday afternoon. The barista was clearly very sour from the very beginning, when my friend asked about their vegetarian options. Her behavior was also extremely passive aggressive, which came to light when she turned up the normally background jazz music to an ear-splitting volume more fitting of a nightclub. My friends and I, after purchasing a bagel and drink, were forced to vacate when the barista tried to engage us in a shouting match after refusing to turn down the volume to a level that is expected from an afternoon cafe. We were not in the mood to make a scene in the city and left. Patrons on Yelp--I recommend for the health of your ears and service expectations, avoid this place at all costs. There are much friendlier establishments on the block.
author: Nancy W.
Candice G.

description: I came in hot in my dragon onesie and Santa hat on SantaCon. Homeboy behind the counter immediately gave me attitude. When I ordered an iced mocha, he looked at me like I was speaking a different language. He neglected to mention that an iced mocha was just a hot mocha with one ice cube that immediately melted, making it a lukewarm mocha that was not very good. So much for honoring your namesake. Then I went to the bathroom and locked the door lock. Unfortunately it didn't actually lock and two people walked in on me. When I mentioned this to the hipster counter guy, he said "oh yes, it does lock." I then knocked over the cups on the counter and walked out. Ok, this last part didn't really happen, but I was pretty disappointed by my experience there. Especially with the counter douche.
author: Jeff W.

description:
everyone working there was perfectly nice. however.

one: what kind of monster puts avocado on a caprese panini? this was unadvertised and unasked-for, and would be flat-out incorrect even if i weren't allergic.

two: this "panini" had never seen the inside of a panini press, which is an abuse of artistic license at best.

three: as a final insult, it was the size of a quarter and dwarfed by a completely undressed side salad. for eleven dollars.

the presentation was actually very nice until i realized i'd been had.
author: Topher H.

description:
Cute spot but I didn't like the coffee. I wanted to like it but I didn't. I tried cappuccino and American, both extremely disappointing... :( I wanted to like them because 1) really nice ambiance and lots of room for seating 2) they are reasonable on the almond milk up charge 3) service was friendly and quick. 

Lots of great things going for this place, but coffee is not good in comparison to the other great places around (I.e contraband). If you are coming for the coffee, don't. If you are coming for a place to hang out with friends and grab a quick snack, yes, this place is perfect.
author: Jenna M.

description: Great coffee shop, quiet and nice for bringing your laptop or just grabbing coffee on the go. My favorite is their ultimate bagel and white mocha. Very friendly staff too!
author: Juan S.

description: I want to like this place because it's so close to work but OWNERS PLEASE GET YOUR S TOGETHER. When it's not out of one thing it's out of another, understaffed always long waits and today cash only? Annoying to be sent to the ATM down the street. I hope the owners use this as constructive criticism. I want to be a regular so I'll try a couple more times. Cute place, nice atmosphere and the Hispanic girl behind the counter is always very friendly.
author: Daniel V.

description:
I found this cute coffee shop on Polk which is a gem to find. Cute and cozy! 
The staff there were so friendly and made me a really nice latte. 
I love coming in here as they have super tasty baked goods from batter bakery!!! Delicious!! They have traditional Turkish coffee which would wake anyone up for a work morning!
author: Sarah O.

description: Such a cute little coffee shop!! Really open and nice ambience and freindly workers. I like sitting at the big windows in the front and get a few sketches in. The music was smooth jazz, and overall vibe was really relaxing and warm. Ordered the white mocha, and it was PERFECTION!!!!!
author: Riya V.

description:
I've had nothing but positive experiences at Moka Coffee. The staff is friendly and warm, always. The pastries are delightful, along with the tea and of course you can't go wrong with a latte. The barista/ manager by the name of Merve makes the best drinks. I love starting my mornings at Moka, truly sets my intentions for the long work day ahead. :) 
Thanks Moka Coffee
author: Ally B.

description:
Bagels don't seem to be fresh (wrapped in plastic)

iced coffee is ehh

chill vibes tho, groceries could be better.
author: Stephen L.

description:
Atmosphere: 5/5
Drinks: 2/5
Service: 3/5

Based on one visit, will definitely update if I come back. Nice place read, study or chat while sipping on the beverage of the gods. The barista wasn't very skilled, my macchiato in order was very bitter. But both people behind the counter are kind.
author: Manny J.

description:
This cafe has a great, characteristic ambiance although the total space is not that big. Large window, bookshelf with interesting books. Friendly barista as well. A nice hideout, people watching place on Polk St.
The coffee itself is just so-so
author: Charles K.

description: Stopped at Moka Coffee to grab a quick mid-day pick-me-up. We ordered coffees and hot chocolates to-go, and were not too impressed by the drinks. The hot chocolates were not hot at all, which is always sad to see. This shop is decent for getting some work done though. There were many Mac users scattered throughout, so I would have felt at home if I was to work here. I still wouldn't prefer it for the coffee, but maybe I need to try a mocha next time I am here.
author: Vats A.

description:
The first in my search for places that offer pots of tea to consume while you're reading or working. This place has a nice ambiance with books and such for decorations. It's very small, though, so don't expect to get a table unless it's an off hour.

A decent price for the pot of tea - $7. I think that's a bit much for something that essentially fills one and a half 16 oz. to go cups. It does help that they serve it with little Turkish teacups to make it feel like you're getting a lot more tea. The quality is pretty good; they use a loose leaf tea which I wish I could've smelled first. I'm not sure how high the quality is, though, and would have to take a look at the leaves again.

The food smelled good and if I were hungry I'd probably stop by and have a snack, too.
author: Robbin A.

description:
Great little spot and right next to bob's donuts. We had he cappuccino and an espresso and both were tasteful and a lot better then the filtered coffee everywhere else. 

Highly recommended to anyone who wants good coffee.
author: Andrew S.

description:
If I could leave zero stars then I would. Never been here before and walked in with a smile, greeted the woman behind the counter and even asked how she was doing. 

The menu boards are very confusing and misleading as to what they offer. First it says all drinks are served hot and cold indicated by blue(cold) and red(hot) dot next to each drink with the exception of a couple that only had a red dot.

When I ask for an iced drink she said, "this is not a Starbucks." Her demeanor, tone, and language was truly appalling. Asking for more time to look over then menu and asking my friend to make sure I was reading the menu right before I ordered again she gave off the most disgusted and annoyed look.

After I tried to order an iced latte she said, "I already told you this isn't a Starbucks." Even thought the menu clearly states that you can order an iced latte. We brought this to her attention, she then stated, "it's only for decoration." (Meaning the red/dots) Needless to say I bought  a bottle of tea to go. 

She is the one with blonde hair and heavy European accent and a resting bitch face. If you go in and see her, turn and run. Do not waste your money. 

To the owners you need a better hiring method. This employee is costing you costumers. Fire and deport her ass.
author: Meagan M.

description:
I had what was probably the worst latte I've ever had, with some kind of strange, almost rancid taste. Luckily, I didn't feel sick afterward, so I don't think it was from the milk. Still couldn't finish more than a quarter of the cup before throwing it out though.

I also tried some of my boyfriend's drip coffee, which was similar to Starbucks and incredibly mediocre. Not much better than what I could make with a cheap Mr. Coffee coffeemaker at home.

With so many better options for coffee in the city, I'd avoid this place.
author: Sara L.

description: Not surprised after reading some of the reviews here. I've visited this place a few times and the coffee is actually quite good. BUT, on 4 different occasions I got here about half n hour to almost 45/50 minutes before closing (on Friday and Saturday) and was told that they were closed. This is unacceptable. If you say you are open until 6pm, but then tell someone who walks in at 5:15pm that your closed, then please change your hours on your website and let customers know. Its a waste of our time to get there, find parking (Pay for parking), then walk in only to be told that the shop is closed or closing. 10-15 minutes before 6pm on a Friday I can understand, you guys are tired and want to go home. But on four different occasions??? Please update your info to say that you're closed an hour ahead of your actual time. I've been here a few times and always try to support local small businesses but will not be coming here again. There are other better coffee places in a 5-6 block radius that do stay open until their stated hours.
author: Ninoh D.

description: I love this cafe. Their coffee is excellent, and their egg and cheese bagel is really good. Since I've started work, I haven't had much time to go here, but before, this was my favorite place to study and grab some coffee. The atmosphere is very comfortable to study in, and the wifi is great. I wish it were a tad bit cleaner, but really not that much of a problem.
author: Madeleine M.

description: They NEED to address the cup/lid situation because the cups/lids provided are beyond terrible. The lid NEVER fit onto my cup securely no matter what I or my husband tried. Not only were our drinks were extremely hot, but mine spilled all over my hands bc the lid would NOT stay on. I guess it tasted ok once it cooled down but it was so difficult and awkward to drink.  I even grabbed extra lids and none of them stayed either. Just going to Starbucks next time.
author: Tina P.

description:
These guys made a great cappuccino and a very solid lox bagel sandwich. They were a little overwhelmed by the morning rush and ran out of iced coffee early on an unusually hot SF morning. But it's a cozy little spot with great coffee and good enough WiFi. I'll be back.

Came here again a few times since my initial review. The folks behind the counter are not very friendly. They never have lox anymore even though it's still on the menu. It's not bad, but I probably won't be back. Theres plenty of other options with better coffee, nicer people and consistent menus in this area.
author: Christopher A.

description:
Quiet,clean and a friendly place. They serve great fresh Well grounded original Turkish coffee!
Ethiopian Harrar drip coffee is plus
author: BaRan S.

description:
I know its called Moka Coffee, but I got their tea. The tea was fantastic. I also got one of  their sandwiches, and that too, was absolutely fantastic. I got the Tomato Mozzarella and Balis melt, and my only complaint with this place is that the sandwich wasn't actually a melt like I expected, more like just a regular cold sandwich. Also what was slightly upsetting is that they didn't have whole milk out for adding into coffee/tea, but I am used to that, and just mixed the available half and half, and the non-fat !ilk that they had out on the counter. 

Besides that, the place itself is a fantastic spot for simply chilling, or getting some work done. Lovely atmosphere, fantastic aesthetic, and they also have plenty of outlets for all of us who are running low on charge on our electronic devices. I would also like to comment on their fantastic serene music choices. I got so much done sitting at the high counter in the front munching on my sanwich and drinking my tea. Usually I have to put my headphones in tyo focus, but at this place I didn't have to. 

Plus: free WiFi.
author: Polina F.

description:
Sometimes you hit a spot at the right moment, and I think that's what happened when Jamie W. and I met up here one evening before going to a Pac Heights dinner party. It's new, isn't it? I think it was a Royal Grounds Coffee cafe before, but the disheveled, slacker vibe has been replaced by a more contempo-modern one with laptoppers here looking more erudite than usual. We were just looking to kill time, so we didn't look dweebily prompt for the party. All the usual caffeine suspects were there at their self-designated espresso bar (photo: http://bit.ly/13FZiKQ). I decided to order a $3.50 Chai Latte (photo: http://bit.ly/11f8OUl). But oh wait, what is that curious-looking chocolate dome in the display case?

Why, it IS a $2.50 Chocolate Dome (photo: http://bit.ly/19jlOwU). It was absurdly good, surprisingly not too sweet for a moist dark chocolate cake covered in a mousse-like covering dusted in cocoa. I could have had a half-dozen. The chai latte was the perfect complement topped with a spritz of Reddi-wip. It was a nice, unexpected treat in a quiet setting on an otherwise busy block. Now I could see this compact place getting crowded very quickly at a later hour. There are really just a handful of tables here, but catch it at the right time, like the late afternoon, and it can feel quite charming. I think the trio of little dogs outside on the sidewalk would agree (photo: http://bit.ly/12kOgfU).

FOOD - 4 stars...a smooth latte and a decadent dome
AMBIANCE - 3.5 stars...small but comfortable when it's not crowded
SERVICE - 3 stars...rather quiet but efficient
TOTAL - 4 stars...a worthwhile Polk Gulch pitstop
author: Ed U.

description:
Modern cafe atmosphere with motivational quotes on the boards against the ceiling!

My friend and I got their Caramel Latte and White Mocha Latte - both were strongly flavored with the distinct taste of caramel and white mocha.  Nicely brewed. 

A small seating area that offers WiFi-guest with no asking for the password.  Simply convenient and relaxing if you decide to do your work or chill here.
author: Tiffany D.

description:
This place is awesome!! The best place to enjoy your coffee while you are working on your computer or just having some tea and enjoy people watching on Polk st. 
Cozy place, cool music..
author: Aytekin T.

description: I wanted to like this place. Seeing as it's walking distance to my apt and super cute. But their regular hot coffee $2.50 tasted so bad. Bitter with a burnt coffee bean taste. I threw it away after a few sips. Maybe it was just a bad batch?
author: Joy M.

description:
Cute place that a friend and I happened across while walking down Polk. The interior looked like a cross between an antique store and bookstore. 

Service was a bit slow, but nothing to complain about. The baristas were helpful in describing unfamiliar items on their menu. We decided to try the Turkish coffee (forgot what it was listed as on the menu), but it ended up being pretty disappointing. It was bitter and tasted a bit like dirt. Neither of us had ever had it before, so maybe the taste takes some getting accustomed to? Needless to say, neither of us finished.
author: Tina X.

description:
I do somewhat like this place, except for the coffee and the service.

Came to this cute little coffee shop quite frequently actually, but I never enjoyed my drink as they always don't make it right. Whenever I come in, the baristas seem to be new and under training, or just really bad. The cashier more than frequently did not know the prices of the drinks I was getting. She usually got flustered and looked at the menu behind her and let me know.

As for the drinks, they oversteamed my cappuccino, and gave me a bitter/burnt  tasting mocha. As I was observing the barista making drinks in general, she just left the milk under the steamer and coming back to it. To have the perfect steamed milk, it needs the attention from its barista. No wonder they never make my coffee right with their half-hearted attention and care. (It wasn't even busy.)

The workers here never gave me a greeting or a friendly vibe. Not even a thank you.

Pros:
Great atmosphere for getting work done
Free wifi
Plenty of outlets
Little to no wait to get your drinks

Cons:
Bad coffee
Bad service

Overall, I tried really hard to like this place and gave them multiple shots, thinking maybe they are just having an off-day and/or a new hire because I want to less frequent the corporate run coffee shops and support local businesses. However, I left with disappointment each time.
author: Solongo B.

description: me and friends came in here after bob's donuts and we are sincerely and genuinely appalled at how awful the service was. we have never really encountered such a rude barista in any other coffee shop. lady with long blonde hair and strong accent LITERALLY SAID TO MY FRIEND "we are not a starbucks you can not order a machiatto" as hard as it is for us to be rude back, we simply looked at the sign behind her which read "hot or cold .. machiatto" ??????? UMMMM???? so we said, "um miss the sign behind you says hot or cold machiatto" she said "I ALREADY TOLD YOU WE ARE NOT A STARBUCKS AND WE DONT HAVE MACHIATTOS." at this point my kind boyfriend intervened and said "sorry ma'am but it literally says you guys serve machiattos on your sign" and she said "no thats just a design" WTF??? we are shocked. absolutely shocked. never ever in a lifetime coming back here with this rude abrasive service.
author: Rania L.

description: Severely disappointing smoothie for $4.95.  I asked for a berry & milk smoothie and got what looked and tasted like a berry flavored glass of milk. Horrible consistency, barely any berry taste, will not be coming back here.  Also, they run their shop understaffed so expect long wait times.
author: Edo C.

description: Moka is one of my favorite cafes nearby my house. I like to come here for breakfast. They have delicious breakfast bagel and sandwiches all day and the prices are very reasonable. I like their coffees and pastries as well. The general atmosphere is cozy, it s a nice place to read a book or work on your laptop. Baristas are very friendly, it is always fun to have conversations with them while having my coffee.
author: Çağlar A.

description: Good music and delicious hot chocolate. Love the views to the street. I really appreciate that they have books to read while enjoying the views. A taste of home!
author: Elia C.

description: I really liked their white mocha, not so much their bagel, cheese, and egg. It was somewhat bland.
author: Isabelle M.

description:
Given the choice between Moka and Royal Grounds, I'd take the latter, mostly because its often indifferent staff at least listened, and knew what they were doing.   The older I get the more I think we ought to be able to whack stupid young people with something that will induce TOL (Temporary Old Age)---for a few weeks, to the extent for a while they will lose their looks, their energy, their 28" waists, and firm breasts, Just So They Will Know...without the decades long interval until real old age settles in.   I'm standing at the counter but a younger guy passes me and walks up to the cash register thing-y, and who gets served first?

Am I Invisible?  Whack!  TOL for two months!

Everyone is young at least once, a lot of old people in San Francisco have never realized they are old---you see them with pink hair in their sixties.  But youthful stupidity is spreading, and Moka seems to hire some of the dimmest bulbs around.  I generally only buy beans here, and they're the good, Second Generation dark roasted variety, not the pale sort popular with the overly bearded.  Coffee for Coffee Drinkers.  Yet every time I've been in to buy beans, the dolt at the counter seems surprised that I would ask to buy whole beans.  Sometimes I have to repeat myself more than twice.  Who works in a coffee house and is surprised that people would buy beans?  Today the guy didn't even know how to close the bag---I kid you not, Mary!   Whack!  Two years of TOL just for being that stupid.  I grant you he was cute, but that's no excuse.
author: Paul T.

description:
Very polite, super-clean coffee shop that makes an excellent Americano.

They have pastries, croissants and some awesome-looking breakfast burritos. 

You should definitely combo a stop at Moka Coffee then at Bob's Donuts like I did today for the perfectly yummy (although not nutritious) breakfast.
author: Jennifer O.

description: 3.5 stars for a decent cappuccino. No fancy pants status like the other SF originals but it feels comfortable in here because it isn't fancy pants. It's comfortable for studying or catching up with a nice breeze when the door is open.
author: Shannon L.

description:
The coffee here is gold. I ordered a plain cappuccino and I was not disappointed. Smooth, subtle earth flavor, clean art, and you can taste more milk than espresso. You definitely feel the caffeine kick in right away! 

Great place to work, however, seating is very limited. The biggest plus is that Bob's Donut and Pastry shop is right down the block- Moka's coffee paired with a donut from Bob's= heaven.
author: Rabail S.

description:
This is a great little coffee place. The atmosphere and decor are nice. There is a moderate amount of seating that I rarely find completely filled so chances are you'll find a place to sit if you need to. 

I always get a pour over at this place. There are several different beans to choose from. The coffee comes out strong and very hot. It's well worth the 3 minute wait. For food, they have a selection of baked goods and a few sandwich/panini options but I haven't tried them myself. My only critique was that the staff was not overly friendly.
author: Charlotte A.

description:
Moka is one of those hipster coffee joints that belongs on Valencia. It just got a little lost when it got to SF.

The boy and I dropped into Moka on our last trip to SF. He needed a coffee and I needed a hot tea. Like stat.

The seating area at Moka was nice though fairly boring. The layout has multiple issues and doesn't allow for a long line, problematic when you also get a traffic jam near the condiments/supplies table which can't be kept up when there's a rush (also because of the layout.)

The service started out friendly and became forgetful after I had to ask twice for a box and to-go cup, finally standing at the front of the line after I watched the girl forget me. 
My peppermint tea was tasty and the baklava we got was good though over honey'd, nothing to write home about.

There's nothing really spectacular about Moka that would bring me back. I think if the the atmosphere were a little more kitschy or funky they would draw better, but there's nothing memorable about the space beyond it's issues.
author: Meg T.

description:
The layout and feel of this little coffee shop is great. Unfortunately I also got the worst café au lait I've ever had, which did set a damper on my enthusiasm. The person behind the counter was, however, very nice and the cookie I got with the coffee was fantastic to boot. Free wifi and plenty of outlets also makes it a great place to get a little work done.

But seeing as it is mainly a coffee place, I have to give two stars for the exceptionally bad coffee I got.
author: Malthe J.

description: I've been coming here since I moved to SF in 2013, great little neighborhood coffee shop, friendly, welcoming, experienced staff who knows what good coffee is, delicious freshly made sandwiches and excellent selection of pastries. Nice simple decor with artsy details that change from time to time. It's a go to spot for a lot of artists around Nob Hill, I've even ran into Metallica's Kirk Hammett here once!
author: Ilker C K.

description: Nice and comfortable atmosphere. Toe tappin', finger snappin' French music. The hot chocolate looked sweet (A+ presentation) but was surprisingly bitter and not very delicious. Anyways - went there for the comfy seating. Would go back but for maybe a different drink.
author: Kristen C.

description:
I've been searching for weeks for a comfortable place to enjoy some delicious espresso, a good snack, decent seating (and outlets), and wifi. I think I found my new spot. HALLELUJAH!! A coffeehouse fiend like me relishes in this moment. Moka is great for several reasons:

1. Their espresso is fantastic: rich, dark, luxurious... as it should be! 
2. Their baristas are friendly... especially the woman with a charming personality and is delightful to interact with.
3. They have a good amount of individual barstools up front and in the back. Not many tables, but that's fine... (may make it hard for socializing or studying with groups of two or more)
4. Moka has tasty pastries. 
5. They have a solid amount of electric outlets.
6. It's bright and airy. Some coffeehouses are *too* cozy or dim to the point of me wanting to just sleep. (At least as someone who works from coffeehouses often, that's a "con.")
7. It's located in a prime location in Nob Hill: close to good hole-in-the-wall places as well as fine dining... and ughhhhh sooo close to Bob's Donuts (I have to constantly stop myself from leaving mid-studying to grab an old-fashioned or buttermilk!). 
8. Close to the 1 MUNI bus.
9. Two sets of bistro seating outside for some street/people watching action.
10. GOOD MUSIC. The Shins, The XX, Phoenix... oh, and some LANA DEL REY REALNESS. 

Thank you for reaffirming my faith in the SF coffeehouse scene, Moka.
author: James Z.

description:
Sigh. I paid $4 for Cafe Au Lait and ended up with a drip coffee. Here's how it went down:

I order a Cafe Au Lait from the smarmy guy at the register. He tells the other guy near the espresso machine to make a cafe au lait. Other guy grabs the teeniest cup (4oz) and proceeds to make some type of drink. When he hands me the mini cup, I ask if it is a drip coffee with steamed milk and he says no. "It's a double shot of espresso with foam on top." Hm, well that isn't what I asked for. So I politely tell him cafe au lait is just drip coffee with steamed milk, no espresso. Cafe (coffee) + Lait (milk).

He dumps out whatever was in the teeny tiny cup, fills it with a splash of drip coffee, and proceeds to steam some milk. I ask if I could have a bigger cup (is it really $4 for 4oz of drip coffee?) so he tosses the baby cup, grabs a larger cup (12oz) and fills it halfway with drip coffee. No matter, I think, the steamed milk will make up for all that empty space in the cup. Nopedy nope, wrong I was. After he finishes steaming the milk, he scoops out only the foam (what is it with this guy and foam?) and places it atop the drip coffee. By now the 12oz cup is a little over half full. He slides it over to me and I actually get two steps out the door before I decide to turn around and ask for a drip coffee instead. 

I could have walked ten more feet to Bob's Donuts for drip coffee, or two blocks up to Contraband for fancy pour-over, or even down the street to It's a Grind where the coffee is subpar but predictable. I should have read a few reviews before wandering into Moka. Even the dirty diner nearby (which I won't name) can make a Cafe Au Lait, and their drip coffee is better.
author: Shaina V.

description:
Moka Coffee used to be the Nob Hill outpost of Royal Ground Coffee. Closed since January 2013, they opened again today after a heavy remodeling (May 13, 2013).

Alas, the new look is proof what happens when you don't get a good interior designer for a remodeling. Let me explain.

The good: The space is much brighter now. They retained the same great baristas (hey Hennessy!). The coffee still packs a punch, though it's 30 percent more expensive now. Espresso drinks saw a 50 Cent mark-up, too. Someone's got to pay for them new chairs.

The bad: The coffee bar got moved to the left side and is much bigger now - it easily takes up 60 percent of the space. The unlucky Fourth Wave at Polk and Bush comes to mind, incidentally closed for a remodeling right now. As a side effect, there seems to be much less seating now - gone are the quirky bench and the round tables on both sides of the shop. There is a window bar where you can sit and face Polk Street, but then you will block the view of the folks sitting on the four tables seating four persons each. On those you will feel oddly trapped, looking at backs and butts of people instead of at Polk Street. Five tables with two bar stools each are directly across from the bar, further narrowing the space between it and the right wall.

The ugly: The bar also contains a food area (not in operation yet). With a fridge. That runs so loud that even the music has a hard time drowning it out. You can even hear it from the outside of the coffee shop. With so many flat surfaces inside, the acoustics are horrible. With seven patrons and three guys behind the bar, we already hit 80 dB and my friend and I had to speak up to understand each other.

Royal Ground used to be a place that fostered community. You were able to sit back and relax, maybe listen in on other folks' sometimes rowdy conversations, share some of your own wisdom and make new friends in the process. Now it's more about being lonely together - you face a maximum of three people and have to talk in raised voices to be able to be heard by them.

In a nutshell, this rebirth is a metaphor for what's happening in San Francisco right now. Quirky places with character are going away, making room for identikit spaces without soul. If that's what the folks riding the Google bus to Silicon Valley like, okay. But it's not something that I or my friends enjoy much.

That said, I'm not one of those that say everything old is good and needs to stay. Top loading washing machines are bad. So are 100 year old sliding windows with a gap that allows the wind to blow into your apartment with force. I just wish the remodeling would have been more in tune with the previous vibe of Royal Ground.

I will be back for a coffee. I just won't enjoy sitting down and watching people while drinking it anymore.
author: Roland A.

description: Update: received an apology from the owner with the promise to look into the incident and speak with his employee.
author: Soo J.

description:
This is my second review .
Five star for friendly staff.the ladies snd gentle men here are sweet as pie.
Three star for coffee.never consistant .pricey.
Teas are good.
Three stars for food.it works.
I preferred the royal grounds cozy atmosphere much more.
The interior is very yipster.soo if you like that clean  soma , marina look you may really like it.just not comfy enough first thing in the morning.music in the early morning Club Music.yikes...I prefer low relaxing stretch to awaken in a.m.
author: Connie B.

description: Wow. I am shocked at the lack of service, knowledge, and product at this establishment.  I had an appointment in the neighborhood and walked around looking for a local place where I could get a chai tea.....I walked in and asked "what kind of chai do you serve?".....the girl working the register replied, "I actually don't know and the barista is on break.".  I brushed it off and ordered an iced chai latte with almond milk.  As I am waiting for my drink, the barista then asked me 3 times what drink I had ordered....the worst part is that I actually watched him make my chai....with POWDERED CHAI MIX....needless to say it was the worst $5 I have ever spent....I will not be coming back....how can you honestly charge $5 for powder and almond milk?
author: Ashley A.

description: We grabbed quick coffee as we waited for swan oyster depot to open. It was a Thursday morning, and maybe one person studying or working. the street was quiet and the cafe still. Cashier was fine, decent nothing special. Coffee was good, nothing spectacular.
author: Roxane P.

description: Cool place but pretty much the only thing they are selling, i.e.  coffee, is not at San Francisco standards at all. With so many other options in the city, I don't think I will come here again for coffee. Also have to say. I guess their barista is a confused guy by nature.
author: Gokhan T.

description: Great local coffee spot. Food is good as well, and prices are reasonable. I usually go with the iced coffee but latte is delicious too. Breakfast sandwiches are pretty good.
author: Max C.

description:
Moka is a joke-a. This would be a decent coffee shop if it was 1990 in Milwaukee. 

If you call it "joe" and are looking for an average cup (let's be real, you can't taste the difference), then Moka will do. If you're looking for a carefully crafted drink that somebody cares about you won't find it at Moka. 

I asked if they had cold brew. The barista said they did and proceeded to serve me a crappy cup of iced coffee. I was so bummed and then I bit into my donut from Bob's and all was okay.

Seriously though, skip it. It would be a real win if this space was taken over by a real coffee shop. Because good coffee with donuts from Bob's would be so cool.
author: Marcus C.

description:
Came here for coffee last Saturday to catch up with my bff and the staff were AMAZING! They were kind enough to satisfy my inner fatty with Bob's donuts from next door and eat them inside their coffee shop. 

Their coffee is strong and flavorful. The best part was the consistency of the foamed milk, it was nice and thick. I also ordered a tea (lavender?) which was also very delicious. I am definitely going to come back and try their tea selection. 

The staff were always cleaning so that's a great sign! 

Note: there was a minimum to use your credit card. 5 or 10 dollars.
author: Suzzie B.

description: Cookie is extremely hard and stale, very bland latte. This was for afternoon coffee break.
author: Catalina C.

description: Drinks are very affordable, lots of power outlet and free wifi. Great place for doing your work ! Although the internet is quite slow at times
author: Elitè T.

description:
Amazing style and lovely Coffee corner.

Finally I can relax working with a lovely tasty coffee.

The place now more bright and calm with nice music in the background. 

I will definitely recommend this place for any one who is tired of finishing a modern style with lovely tasty coffee.1
author: Omran I.

description:
A welcome replacement to the old coffee shop that was there...the drip coffee was good, better than the crap you get from the blue fog, Starbucks or it's a grind. 
I didn't have anything else but the coffee was good.
author: Nilu r.

description:
I absolutely loved the cappuccino here....Sadly I've had multiple times now where the service has been lacking. I've probably been here 10 or more times since I live close and I'd say at least 6 the waitstaff left a bitter taste in my mouth. They always act like they are SO busy/stressed out (hello, its a coffee shop and morning time)! They make me feel guilty almost when ordering more than one thing or food. Seriously, there are other places that are happy to get my business and delighted when I spend over the average 4 dollars. I will probably be back  eventually because my husband loves the drip coffee but I'm disappointed in the service/attitudes here.

Edit: not sure what the change was that made everyone more enjoyable to encounter but they have definitely improved on being much more welcoming!
author: Kelsey S.

description:
Suuuuuuuuper strong coffee. Super super strong. I sniffed the 4 bean options for the pour-over coffee, and requested the lightest roast. Even so, it came out being terribly strong / dark / heavy / burnt... can't imagine how dark the French roast must've been. I added heaps of sugar to my coffee and it still wasn't palatable for me. Just too dark for my personal taste, but I'm sure it would appeal to some caffeine junkies out there. :)

That being said, the interior is roomy and quirkily designed. Plenty of wall outlets and tables inside and outside for working / hanging out. The presentation of the drinks (ie. my friend's cafe latte) was nice.

BTW, $5 minimum for credit card!
author: Cathy X.

description: I love americano coffee in Moka, and great pastry selection. Social Neighborhood stop!
author: Dennis Uluç' T.

description: Nice little and cozy coffee place at corner of Polk/Sacramento. Serves good coffee (royal ground coffee) as well as tea. They also offer a variety of fresh made sandwiches and breakfast items and pastries. Bar style tables/seats and normal tables available. Nice deco with bookshelves, poems on the walls and most of all the big painting above the bar showing the manufacturing process of coffee! Well done!
author: Roman B.

description:
Great little spot to grab coffee and tea on Polk Street. 

Nice decor. Cool music. 

BUT, I don't understand why you won't take credit cards for sales under $5. 

You use Square Register which charges a flat 2.75% for all swiped transactions, so your cost is the same if I spend $10 or $2. 

https://squareup.com/help/us/en/article/5068-square-s-fees-and-pricing

I hate carrying cash. Please change your policy. It doesn't make any sense if you're losing sales.
author: Billy G.

description: Latte is the worst burned taste I've experience in a long time!
author: Ryan O.

description:
Really cute coffee shop with good atmosphere. Didn't even have any coffee but ordered a green tea with a panini. 

When I asked the guy behind the counter with a man bun and a German/Austrian accent what his favorite sandwich was...he replied with "I hate them all". And then justifies his statement by saying "I just hate making them but I guess I like this one best". I ordered my sandwich anyway and watched him make my sandwich. He proceeded to lick his fingers and then continue making my sandwich. 

I'm sure there's sanitation problems no matter where you go. And I'm sure he did it as a habit (when I cook at home I'll do it too) but still...watching a stranger lick his fingers then touch my food? Not cool. Also the attitude. Try to like your job a little bit?
author: K M.

description: Excellent place for coffee, reasonably priced, and hang out.  Small but good atmosphere.
author: Steve M.

description:
I've now spent 4 lovely mornings in this coffee shop and do believe it is a-okay.

I sincerely enjoy the rich mix of customers (gender, ethnicity, age, etc.), background music that might be a couple dB too loud and, of course, the really wonderful coffee drinks whether espresso, ice coffee, depth charge or caffe macchiato.

The wait staff are very friendly and welcome all without fear or favor.

Yessiree, the Moka Coffee near on the intersection of Polk and Sacramento Streets is a-okay and so says I.
author: Jay D.

description: You'll be charmed by the rustic interior and will stay for the amazing coffee. Not bitter, the coffee is brewed at just the right temp and for just the right portion. Add a cookie on the side, and let the conversation continue!
author: Regina D.

description:
Nice coffee space with seating for people who want to get work done, have an intimate chat, or simply wish to people watch along Polk street.

They also have a plethora of outlets, free wi-fi, and $1 day-old pastries. A no-frills, low-key place.
author: Betty S.

description: Paid $3 for a single shot of bitter, acidic espresso which I threw out after a couple of sips. Ripoff!
author: Ritch G.

description: I was quite excited to see a good-lucking coffee place near Bob's - just what the area needed. However, inside seemed a bit less exciting. My latte was completely fine, but the ordering was a little awkward. I'd try Saint Frank up the street next time.
author: Lisa K.

description: Merve, Halil and the whole staff are incredible. Fresh breakfast sandwiches at a really reasonable price and the drinks are also great. I've had the Turkish chai and the Latte, definitely recommend both. Çok sağol!
author: Janesh R.

description: I feel like Moka is going downhill - the espresso just isn't as good as it used to be. My cappuccino was just overly bland - it had no kick to it. Tasted like warmed milk with a hint of espresso. This used to be my go to spot for coffee, but I think I have to move on.
author: Mike L.

description:
Nice staff. Super freaking awesome chai. I wanted to rub it all over my body and then drown in it. 

Not literally. 

...

..maybe.
author: Morgan H.

description: Cute neighborhood coffee shop at the corner of polk and sacramento st.. I love grabbing a cup of tea here with friends and family. My favorite spot in the shop is the counter near the window where you can people watch.
author: Alya G.

description:
This was a pretty unsatisfactory experience. This place looks like it wants to be a serious coffee shop from the outside, but when I went in I saw a lot of red flags:

- The barista said she doesn't drink coffee.
- There was a $5 minimum charge for credit cards.
- Their coffee was pre-ground and stored in the open (not in a sealed container).
- The barista poured my drip coffee with a wide spout kettle (not a gooseneck as it should be), and she did so carelessly and far too quickly, with no regard for technique.

The end result? An extra large coffee that tasted like DIRT.

The only positive of the whole experience was that the barista was nice and offered to waive the minimum charge when I told her I didn't have cash.

That said, the coffee was inexcusably bad given the $2.75 price tag, much worse than even Starbucks.

Next time I'll walk the extra two blocks to Contraband Coffee.

EDIT: On further consideration, I'm upping my rating to 2 stars. I feel that my original rating was unduly harsh, especially since the barista was nice. That said, it still bothers me that this place presents itself as a serious coffee shop while serving absolutely wretched coffee.
author: Alex C.

description:
Nice place on Polk Street, which I almost never come to. Good coffee, free wi-fi, and pastries are half-off after 3pm. (Score!) Lots of books around to pick up and read, which I totally appreciate. A TV was on with Spanish-language soap operas playing but the sound was turned all the way down. So if you weren't sitting in the window to watch the drama of Polk, you could still get your fill, I guess. :-)

The server was very, very nice. Restroom was clean. And Sade was playing. I give it a thumbs up!
author: Lisa W.

description:
Possibly the worst, most bitter cappuccino I've ever had in San Francisco. I took 1 sip, added a bit more sugar hoping it would cut the rough taste, tried one more sip, then handed it back to the barista and walked out.

Would definitely not return.
author: Captain B.

description:
Excited to see this hip new cafe in my neighborhood. The coffee shop that was here before was very mediocre (I think it might be the same owners, just new name and renovation now? Not sure). 

Anyway, we wandered in after having some crepes at The Crepe House for a sweet non-coffee drink. When we walked up to the counter, the woman working was talking to two customers Then, they all left the cafe together. Not sure why (I didn't know what they were talking about because it was in another language). My boyfriend and I stood awkwardly at the barista-less counter for 5 minutes or so, wondering if this meant that the biscottis were all free (not really, we're not thieves). 

When she returned, I was excited to order the Hot Apple Cider that was on the chalk board menu. She said, "we don't serve that." I responded, "It says Hot Apple Cider on your menu" and pointed to it. She stared at it for a moment. Then, looked through all the refrigerators and finally said, "We're out of apple juice." So, not sure if they ever serve Hot Apple Cider or if, maybe, they sometimes serve Hot Apple Juice. We ordered the Lavender Drop tea instead. She dropped a tea bag into a cup of way too hot water and charged us $2.75. For a tea bag. I'm sorry I need to repeat that. A tea bag in a cup of water was nearly $3.00. I had to ask for a sleeve so I could pick up the cup and she looked annoyed. I won't be returning for Hot Apple Juice (if/when they have it) or a rare and golden tea bags anytime soon. I'll walk the two extra blocks to It's a Grind for a Hot Apple Cider.
author: Hazel J.

description: The worst coffee I have ever drink !!! All kinds of Coffees are so bad !! Coffee seeds are siting in the jam in front of the sun !!!  I tried turkey sandwich and I hate it !
author: Görkem A.

description: Great coffee, quick service, I get their Americano.  You won't regret it!
author: John L.

description:
Renovated coffee joint with what seems like new owners.  Regardless, I like the changes.  The place feels clean; the folks behind the coffee bar are sweet and welcoming; and, the mural and "life" quotes on the walls are great.  

I ordered a latte for $3.50 and while it was nothing spectacular, it definitely hit the spot.   I sat on the stools along the front window in the sunshine and read my book while occasionally checking my email.  Perfectly relaxing one hour break from my day.

Things to note: there's a $5 minimum for credit cards; they serve food (bagels + cream cheese and a variety of sweets); and there's two tables out front if you want fresh air while getting your caffeine fix.
author: Kimya P.

description: I am not sure where Moka gets their coffee, but I would sure like to. This coffee is amazing and so strong! It tastes like it was harvested from the earth directly before being poured into the cup. Seriously love this place!
author: Christine E.

description:
Merve still rocks this place!!! She makes food fast and hot, and is really pleasant to her customers.

This is the cafe that used to have the weird vibe - and 99% of that has gone. It's now more hipster. In a good way :-)

The lattes are always stellar! There is a gluten-free pastry available, along with yoghurts, sandwiches (BLT is good!) and a basket of fruit.

One request for the manager: Some wacky customers harassing other customers on the premises. Oh Mister Manager, please can you make your customers feel like the cafe is more safe and welcoming?

Otherwise, still a great place to hang out!!
author: Jen S.

description: Their ice coffee is really good, it's special how they change there barista everyday.  It's a good self-study place!! Recommend students to come~
author: Lina F.

description: I enjoyed this place with my friends. It Was my first time but definitely be back. Friendly staff, yummy sandwiches.
author: Lily I.

description: When these two girls r going to get their english,service and coffee making skill improve?!? Stopped going there for a while , came back this time and also the same wowww!! Very impressed!!!
author: Pam U.

description: Stopped in for an iced latte. Service was good. Coffee was great. Will add them to my coffee rotation.
author: Stephanie T.

description: Love this place - super friendly people, lots of seating, outlets everywhere, good wifi, good food, good coffee, good breeze and view of the street, and good prices. There are almost always places to sit if you need to get work done. And unlike a lot of cafes nearby, Moka doesn't take itself too seriously. I live in the area, and it's my top choice for a coffee and breakfast
author: Dan A.

description: A decent regular coffee and Americano.  The mocha is too sweet and I personally think that it's too expensive.  The staff is really nice and the vibe is good, though.  It is near TOAST, which always seems to have a line wrapped around the block for American brunch these days.  So, the overflow crowd seems to stop by here for a coffee while waiting.  There is wi-fi and some tables for seating and people watching on Polk.  Also, on warm days, they leave the windows and door open, which makes a great spot to enjoy the nice weather AND your coffee.
author: Hiromi N.

description:
Ordered a soy latte.  It was unpalatable and had to throw it away after 2 sips because the soy milk was thick & old.  

Checked my emailed receipt to see that they gave themselves a $2 tip on Square.  I was never asked to sign anything.  Not cool and definitely illegal.
author: Laura B.

description: I like this place. There are a few key Nob Hill coffee establishments, and this one is near the top of the list--especially on a weekday afternoon, a great time to study/get some work done. Iced coffee was great.
author: Mel G.

description:
Music is good. Chill, and lots of bar stool seating, but not a ton of reg tables and chairs. They've got the Cadbury Flake and Kinders chocolates. Hello happy calories!

I came on a Sun at 7 so no idea how good the service is. The coffee is ok. I'd come back.
author: Jean Francois K.

description:
The coffee was okay. It was a turn-off when my friend saw a cockroach running around, but we figured it came in from outside because the door was open.

However, it's never a sign of a good business, when they are chasing you out of the store because they have friends waiting for them and they decide to close an hour early. The store closes at 8 and we were chased out with the other customers at 6.45.

Won't be back. There are too many coffee shops that appreciate your business to come back here.
author: Maggie D.

description: We were just on town and wanted coffee. The service was so poor, they forgot our orders, didn't give us our coffee until we asked. The girl behind the counter was so rude, and bossy. The sandwiches made by the girl, we're terrible and she acted like it was our fault. She screamed at us for asking any questions and blamed us for them only having one toaster to make our sandwiches. Just such bad service all in all. I would never go back to be dealt with by such a foreigner.
author: Carla O.

description:
Nice place to sit and enjoy the coffee hat is if you like the typical Italian roast. Wish they actually serve their single origins at the shop 
Suggestion: new cups/ mugs .. Can hardly hold onto the mug
author: B N.

description: great spot for coffee and hangout - mellow vibe, nice people, the old gathering place for mellow people on polk street that i can find. i really love it here!
author: Jen O.

description: This is a solid, go-to neighborhood coffee shop. The breakfast sandwiches are freshly made, and the coffee is good. It's also a nice space-- a place to hang out and read or to meet a friend to chat. Definitely recommend.
author: Kathleen M.

description: Coffee is a little bitter and burnt tasting but the pastries are tasty!  The service is always very nice.
author: Chelsea D.

description: Its a decent coffee shop. Very nice designed and friendly stuff. They said hi with smily face right when i walked in . Had a cup of house coffee. Very nice. I would say exactly my taste. Plus its a good place to get work done. I like the way they play bice french music always. Good job worht that 5 stars.
author: Alvy S.

description: (10.3.14) Was waiting for my sister to get her haircut across the street so I went to get a latte. It was a super hot day but I still ordered a hot coffee. The atmosphere is nice with wifi and plenty of seating area. I got my coffee and looked like he attempted on coffee art and failed. I've had better lattes at a chain coffee shop.
author: Jan H.

description: I have only recently became a fanatic of coffee, but I was lucky enough to stop by this establishment. The service was terrific, I was given my coffee with a side of milk with 3 options of sugar and a nice metal spoon to stir. They serve your coffee with a coffee plate and a metal spoon, starbucks is making millions and they use paper everything. I like the idea of giving a local business owner my support so I will be stopping by again.
author: Iliana S.

description:
I didn't realize this place has been opened in my neck of the woods since 2011!

I found it on a fluke and was glad that I did--pretty good coffee, nice vibe and friendly people.

I'll be back
author: This Is M E.

description: Kind staff, quick service. Gave us a good pick-me-up on the walk home. Loved the vegan peanutbutter fudge collision cookies w an Americano.
author: Andrea D.

description:
I usually get my coffee fix from The Crepe House, but I love trying new coffee joints, so I decided to come here (bad move). The decor and environment was quite nice and everything was looking great. I ordered a regular size Soy Latte for $3.75 to go, admired the interesting quotes and books and left.

THEN, I tasted my latte. It was the worst latte I have ever bought. Really, it was.
-Too much coffee, not enough milk.
-Milk was not steamed properly, it just tasted like hot milk, instead of thickened milk.
-Bubbly foam on top.
-WORST of all, I opened the top and noticed a lot of coffee grounds in the latte. Wow...

Anyways, I wrote this review in detail hoping the management would notice and the staff could work on their drinks.

Maybe I'll try again in a few months or when I see someone different working there.
author: Bellal N.

description: This place is slow and my coffee drink sub-par. I ordered an iced coffee, but they didn't have any, so I went with an iced Americano. There was only one person in front of me who ordered a regular coffee. I still waited more than five minutes while the employees chatted for them to have the espresso shot, water, and ice ready. There were only a few pieces of melting ice at the top and the drink was warm. I had to ask twice for them to pour it out and add enough ice to make it cold. The employees were nice about it, but for a place that only sells coffee you'd expect a little more finesse.
author: Halee H.

description: I've always liked the coffee (drip, Americano), but they close early (5 p.m.), which seems odd for a coffeeshop, especially since the supply is dwindling on Polk.
author: Keith J.

description: Great staff! Very accommodating and helpful. I got the lavender tea and it was very aromatic. Good vibe and ample seating--I think it's my new place to study.
author: Maliha Z.

description: really a good location but terrible coffee... their drip coffee is watery and their cappuccino tasted rancid. a lot of better options around. AVOID
author: M S.

description:
Replacement for Royal Ground Coffee.  Cleaner, nicer decor and furniture.  Free internet, no password.  All improvements but that's where it ends.

Various up-sell attempts at the counter and advertising for the Luxor Las Vegas on their coffee cups made this place feel cold and transactional to me.  Cash only which I found annoying.

On to the coffee and food: Drip coffee is not individual pour-over style but batch prepared.  At 9am this morning, my coffee tasted dirty and smoky.  Shouldn't be like this during a high turnover time of day.  Pastries were individually wrapped in plastic, suggestive that they were left over from the previous day.  I didn't bother sampling.
author: David C.

description: Nice and quiet, which was just what I needed to cool down before work. The mocha was delicious, not too sweet and not too bitter, and the barista was respectful and quick to make coffees, even when there were a few people in line. Looks like a good assortment of treats and sandwiches, too, so I'll definitely be back to try some!
author: Parker E.

description:
Wow, awesome new cafe on Polk! Opened just yesterday. 

Beautiful space, lots of tables and chairs with outlets (if you need to get some work done), very good coffee, tea. espresso, etc. and they even have great food: panini's, salads, pastries, etc. 

There's a shelf with books you can read while you hang out -- very cool touch! 

The people that work here are awesome and have a big smile on their faces. 
Plus, the owner is one of the kindest, coolest people I've ever met. 

P.s. this place took over Royal Ground Coffee,  a dark old place that had very mediocre food and a lame atmosphere. Sure, they were nice folks, and yes it attracted a very specific type of "SF" crowd (like the guy in the previous review states) but I think this place is much better suited for Polk st. 

It's a cafe, and a cafe is supposed to be a business, not a place to build a "community". Nonetheless, if you happen to hang out and stay awhile you will totally enjoy the ambience.
author: Karl P.

description:
This place has the strangest problem that I have ever found in a coffeehouse: a refrigerator that is so loud that it dominates the atmosphere.

It's like sitting in the engneering room of a naval vessel!

The coffee is decent, there are outlets, and I like the young ladies who work here.
author: John S.

description: Friendly staff, but shitt coffee and take credit cards like an old corner store owned by the old country (ie ten dollar minimum).
author: Martin F.

description: We stopped in randomly and it was a lovely coffee shop. The chai latte was fantastic (so much so that I had two), my husband's white mocha was delicious. The atmosphere was wonderful, it was fairly quiet, and I loved what I saw. I would wander back in anytime I'm in the area :)
author: Renee W.

description: Great place to get your daily dose of caffeine.  I'm addicted to their Americano and scones. They recently upgraded all their furniture and place is eveb better than before. Staff are clean, polite, and know how to make a cup of joe.
author: Amir A.

description: Was in the area to meet up with a friend for lunch but our first choice place had moved locations and I was starving and craved coffee so we tried Moka as this was the closest coffee place I saw. Had an almond milk latte and a sandwich and my friend got a cappuccino with a cookie. I told them we were eating there (and not taking our orders to-go) so I was surprised they served my latte in a paper cup, unlike my friend's drink which they served in an actual mug. Thought service in that case was a bit off. They also didn't bother to bring out my order as we sat outside, so my sandwich had been sitting on the pick up counter forever. If they called it out I definitely didn't hear it. Another service point docked there. I've had many almond milk lattes from various places and I'd say theirs was ok. Service was spotty. Not worth coming back when there are plenty of other good coffee places around.
author: HM N.

description: Came here today to get a latte! This was hands down one of the best lattes I have ever tried! Will definitely come back again!
author: Jessie F.

description: Chai Lattes are delish. So is the barista.
author: Heather L.

description: Solid coffe joint with a generoud pastry selection;
author: Patrick P.

description: The coffee was pretty good. I bought a mocha and it cost me $4.25. I just moved up here from SoCal and I think that price is a bit steep. I'm giving this place 3 stars because they don't accept credit card purchases for under $5. Resultantly, I bought a "Monkey Muffin." It had peanuts and banana in it - this was pretty damn good actually. The service was good, the seating a bit awkward. I'd come back if I was craving another mocha. This coffee place just doesn't grab me though.
author: Zack K.

description:
I am so happy that this place has been revamped and reopened as a cleaner, more approachable coffeeshop.  I have lived in this neighborhood for six years, and I used to walk by the old Royal Grounds every evening... quickly... trying to ignore the odd characters parked outside sipping coffee and smoking cigarettes.  You could not pay me to go in there.  The old dark, dreary cafe is gone, and now we have a nice, bright local establishment that provides a much needed alternative to It's A Grind (meh) and Crepe House (I am still upset at how much their coffee started sucking as of a few years ago) and is not as far of a walk (uphill) as my new favorite coffeeshop Flour + Co. and the tried and true Contraband (also farther and slightly uphill).

I tried the carrot ginger bread this morning -- moist, spicy, delicious.  Their coffee is good, not great, but it does the trick.  I will be getting morning coffees from here instead of the Starbucks by my office from now on.  I really want this place to do well and to bring in a more diverse crowd of clientele (like me) than the old Royal Grounds haunt.  

Moka Coffee is a lovely addition to the neighborhood.
author: Becca W.

description: Great hot coffee, not weak, very tasteful. I went in for coffee and also had an egg bagel which was made very fresh.  Woman serving Everyone was happy and efficient. Good selection of pastries as well.
author: David F.

description: Another good quality coffee place in the hood, tried the americano, espresso and the latte so far and were all great!
author: Beril Y.

description: The lattes are solid. The baked goods are yummy. The staff and the owner let you hang out right up until and usually past closing time. This place is a huge improvement over when it was a Royal Grounds. I've been back about four times and plan to continue returning.
author: Matthew J M.

description: Got the white mocha and it warmed me like I've never been warmed before - almost as if a new sun was born inside of me. Also, the tree at the corner of the bar was very nice. It's a must visit!
author: Cody Y.

description: Not too helpful, limited choices, not accommodating .. Not sure how long they will last
author: Nick S.

description: My office is one  block away and I go here every day.  I like filter coffee, and I was either walking to Peet's or across the street to Blue Fog.   Moka has had consistently excellent filter drip coffee,  morning and evening.  Morning staff *Christina* is nice and rockstar behind the counter.
author: John M.

description: Stunning example of a bad caffé experience. Take a great location, a warm interior with outdoor seats, and a cute blondie barista. Have blondie flirt with coworker in foreign tongue. The result? A scorching-hot, tongue-burning cup of liquid dirt, served with so little care that this customer had to find it a half-inch in from her side of the counter. Makes me miss the Royal Grounds that used to be there.
author: L.D. K.

description: The refrigerators have serious problems-SO NOISY! The music is too loud and they play commercials-annoying!It's not a bar or club. The tea I had was strong and good.
author: Emmanuella A.

description: Great staff, strong coffee, good neighborhood vibe. I didn't have enough cash today to pay for my drink and even though I asked if I could buy another patron's coffee to meet the $5 card minimum, they let me use the honor system to get it free today and pay for it next time I come in! Love this place!
author: Casey M.

description: love the atmosphere and local feel of the place. i can sit at the window counter for hours vibing to the good music and people watching.
author: ronda a.
